body.class: mediawiki ltr ns-6 ns-subject page-File_Flag_of_the_United_States_svg skin-vector

img.alt: File:Flag of the United States.svg

div.p: Flag_of_the_United_States.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 1,235 × 650 pixels, file size: 1 KB)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

a.title: This page is protected against reuploading.

th.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; vertical-align: top; padding-right: 0.4em; width: 15%

td.span: Flag of the United States.svg

div.a: Flag of the United States of America
Flagge der Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika

a.title: es:Bandera de los Estados Unidos de América

div.a: Bandera de los Estados Unidos de América

td.div: Gaeilge: Bratach na Stáit Aontaithe Mheiriceá
Gaelg: Brattagh ny Steatyn Unnaneysit America
Interlingue: Flagga del Unit States de America

a.title: ja:アメリカ合衆国の国旗

div.a: Vlag van de Verenigde Staten van Amerika

td.div: Novial: Flage de Unionati States de Amerika
Nouormand: Couleu d's Êtats Unnis d'Améthique
Diné bizaad: Wááshindoon Bikéyah Ałhidadiidzooígíí bidah naatʼaʼí
Deitsch: Faahne vun die Vereenichde Schaate vun Amerikaa
Scots: Banner o the Unitit States o Americae
Gagana Samoa: Fu'a o Iunaite Sitete o Amerika
Tagalog: Watawat ng Estados Unidos ng Amerika

th.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; padding-right: 0.4em; white-space: nowrap

td.p: 11 September 2005–14 May 2008, based on the above flag law as amended by Executive Order No. 10834 dated 21 August 1959.
SVG implementation of U. S. Code: Title 4, Chapter 1, Section 1 [1] (the United States Federal “Flag Law”).

td.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; padding-right: 0.4em; font-weight: bold

a.title: File:Flag of the United States and Ireland.png

li.a: Flag of the United States and Ireland.png

p.style: width:30em; border:2px solid #55b05a; margin:1px 0; background:#fff; color:#000;

div.p: W3C ✓ The source code of this SVG is valid

ul.li: The geometric specifications for the union jack and the sizes and positioning of the stars are given in an attachment to Executive Order 10834 of 21 August 1959, printed in 3 CFR, 1959–1963 Comp., p. 368. Also see File:US Flag spec TIOH 5-1-17 1967.jpg, the specification drawing from the Army Institute of Heraldry.

The official colors are part of the Standard Color Reference of America, specifically Cable Nos. 75001 (“White”) , 70180 (“Old Glory Red”) , and 70075 (“Old Glory Blue”) . Colorimetric designations for these colors were precisely specified in a 1946 paper in JOSA. When the white point is taken to have the luminous reflectance of the flag’s white, these colors can be approximated on screen as , , and , respectively.
For more details on the design and colors, see Design of the Flag of the United States at the English Wikipedia.

The current dimensions of the image (version of 00:43, 14 May 2008), 1235 × 650 pixels (which represents an aspect ratio of 1.9:1.0), were chosen to allow as much as possible of the final geometric manipulations to be performed using whole numbers, avoiding the need for scaling. (This also results in each stripe being 50 pixels high.)

The versions of 04:42, 5 April 2007, and later (which were written from scratch) are ineligible for copyright and in the public domain. (Earlier versions were derived from the Open Clip Art library and were covered by the Open Clip Art license.)

table.style: border:2px solid #d3d3d3; background-color:white; clear: both; margin: 0.5em auto; width:100%; text-align:center; cellpadding:0px; direction:ltr;

tr.td: It is easy to put a border around this image:

img.alt: Flag of the United States.svg

td.span: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

span.small: This tag does not indicate the copyright status or the source of the attached work. A normal copyright tag and a source are still required. See Commons:Licensing for more information.

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 06:07, 29 July 2010

td.span: (Reduce code)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 18:24, 14 July 2010

td.span: (new colors as per w:Talk:Flag of the United States)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:02, 27 November 2009

td.span: (version by Carl Lindberg)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:23, 26 November 2009

td.span: (no... _I_ am the one reverting to the status quo, you just reverted to the new version)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 06:32, 26 November 2009

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 20:37, 24 November 2009 Revert to the status quo. Please start a new discussion on the talk page.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 06:09, 26 November 2009

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 04:59, 21 November 2009)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 20:37, 24 November 2009

td.span: (Reduce code)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 04:59, 21 November 2009

td.span: (cleanup)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 22:00, 17 November 2009

td.span: (Now this time it works. All code was saved, except for the beginning (redundant code). )

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:11, 16 November 2009

td.span: (Reduce code)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 18:00, 1 November 2009

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 21:13, 11 October 2009 (colors were not referenced, I will speak to you on IRC Huib))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 17:18, 1 November 2009

td.span: (Per talkpage)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:13, 11 October 2009

td.span: (Pantone colors from the US Embassy in London, shades from http://www.pantone.com/pages/pantone/colorfinder.aspx)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 00:43, 14 May 2008

td.span: (Flipped definition of "pt" to point upward (previously pointed downward) in order to make the code more intuitive; expanded "id" names to make code more readable; see discussion page for more info.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 17:30, 13 May 2008

td.span: (Tightened file size further, plus made minor modifications to allow the SVG file to be rendered properly by browsers with less robust SVG support (such as Apple Safari))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 09:30, 13 May 2008

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 04:42, 5 April 2007)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 20:05, 7 April 2008

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 23:02, 28 March 2007)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 04:42, 5 April 2007

td.span: (Proposed simplified version written from scratch, derived directly from http://assembler.law.cornell.edu/uscode/html/uscode04/usc_sec_04_00000001----000-notes.html (should be geometrically identical))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:02, 28 March 2007

td.span: (fixing doctype)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 10:35, 26 April 2006

td.span: (rm unnecessary attributes I added in last version)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 10:32, 26 April 2006

td.span: (wrap "reusable code" in <defs> tag as recommended by wc3)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:54, 26 April 2006

td.span: (add metadata, some id's)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:27, 26 April 2006
Thumbnail for version as of 19:01, 24 March 2006

td.span: (Stars are now exact. Based on an idea of User:Pumbaa80.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:08, 28 January 2006

td.span: (Previous version had a miscalculation--stars were shifted left by 0.02%, whoops! Also, this version now uses viewBox to have a reasonable default size.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 00:09, 29 November 2005

td.span: (more precise version: stars are now accurate to 42 decimal places)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:44, 3 October 2005

td.span: (change red back to BF0A30, and completely rewrite SVG code, using Zscout's <use> tag idea, but with increased precision)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:10, 3 October 2005

td.span: (Made it into a 130 pixel hoist, as per request on my talk page.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:02, 3 October 2005

td.span: (The cloning is done, but everyone is welcome to reduce the file size even more. :D)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 10:06, 1 October 2005

td.span: (change red back to BF0A30, according to cited references)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 04:15, 27 September 2005

td.span: (Made the flag 300x570, fixed the colors. I also cut the file size down by over half. I am going to reduce it more once I have time.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 02:28, 11 September 2005

td.span: (change red to BF0A30, blue to 002868, according to w:Image talk:Us flag large.png)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 02:25, 11 September 2005

td.span: (from http://openclipart.org/clipart/signs_and_symbols/flags/america/united_states.svg, by Daniel McRae, PD)
